clinical_study.brief_title: Fungal Infection After Oral Cavity Surgeries
clinical_study.official_title: Fungal Infection After Oral Cavity Surgeries

brief_summary.textblock: this prospective study we will examine the prevalence of fungal infection in patients undergoing oral cavity surgery without treatment with antifungal drug

primary_outcome.measure: prevalence of fungal infection in patients undergoing oral cavity surgery without treatment with antifungal drug.
primary_outcome.description: 40 patients undergoing oral cavity surgery and 40 patients (control group) undergoing thyroidectomy or parotidectomy for our research measurement :Throat culture for fungal pathogens

clinical_study.condition: Prevalence of Fungal Infection in Patients Undergoing Oral Cavity Surgery Without Treatment With Antifungal Drug

arm_group.description: A control group will be taken ,patients undergoing thyroidectomy or parotidectomy

intervention.description: Throat culture for fungal pathogens will be taken before surgery, at post-operative day (POD) 3 and 2 weeks after the operation

study_pop.textblock: Patients > 18 years old, undergoing oral cavity surgery at ENT department and maxillofacial surgery department, Rambam medical center between May 2019-May 2021

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age over 18
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous oral cavity surgery.
- Previous radiotherapy to the head and neck.
- Previous treatment with antifungal drugs in the 30 days preceding the surgery Immunocompomised state at the date of surgery.
- Pregnancy
- Lack of follow-up
